content.description:
Starts on the right side of a cave. Easy moves lead up to a big reach to a hueco in the roof by the fourth bolt, then moves slightly left, sharing the last few bolts with Sister Chromatid.

For full value, climbers can continue straight up past the first anchor for another ~6-7 bolts of easy terrain.
content.location: Right side of the small cave just right of Old Pine.

content.description: Almost the same as Sunset Lanes not as crimpy though but with a longer crux section.
content.location: Just to the left of Sunset lanes.

content.description: Begin on a series of sloping edges that aren't as good as they look from the ground. Work up to a detached block with good underclings and sidepulls to thinner climbing above.
content.location: Climber's left of the small cave at the Alley (downhill from Sondance), currently marked with a stone with the route's grade.

content.description: Starts out on a nice easy slab, goes up to a vertical technical crimpy crux then to an overhang at the top where the chains are.
content.location: i think its the fifth route on the wall. might be the sixth. I'll go make sure next time i am there.

content.description: I don't think there is much of a destinctive crux on this route it's pretty sustained from the ground up. a very thoughtful route.  you have to  figure it out almost the whole way up.
content.location: About 20 meters left of the cave.

content.description: Starts out with a bit of easy slab climbing then goes almost vertical and right into the crux. which is a reachy move off of a crimp up to a decent edge. then the rest of the climbing is pretty easy. awesome features though. If you like an easy climb with a little boulder problem on it then this ones nice.
content.location: the third route on the wall

content.description:
Climb up left side of the cave and then traverse rightward along the slanting lip to a skinny vertical pod on the headwall.  This is where the route merges with

The Weirding Way

. Rest up and climb a short crux followed by jugs to an intermediate anchor where the steep climbing ends.  Can keep going past more bolts up the slab to the top anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts to first anchor/15 bolts to top anchor
content.location: Starts next to Old Pine and splits right.

content.description: S&G climbs the 2nd bolt line from the left on the far left side of the Alley.  High quality rock interesting holds makes this a great warm-up.
content.location: Down the hill from Sundance by 25ft

content.description: Starts with a slab and goes vertical and crimpy and right into the crux then chills a bit then takes a bit of figuring at the top. the rock on this climb is a bit sharper than the other climbs. so if this is at the top of your grade for climbing you might come away with a few cuts or scrapes. still an awesome line though.
content.location: to the left of it's a good life.

content.description: Climb up some ledges and jugs going out of the left side of the cave. Then onto a 5.9 slab that traverses up and left and takes a bit of thinking to get through.

Pretty similar to Sunset Lanes and 3 Pump Chump. Starts out on an easy slab then climb three or four bolts to a hands off rest. might be tricky to figure out but its there. takes a bit of body tension. then continue through three or four bolts to a bulge. go up to the right a bit and over the bulge and try not to shit yourself as you look for a way to get to the runners and up to the next bolt then up to the chains. Awesome climb!!
content.location: just left of 3 Pump Chump. Starts on the same slab.

content.description: great climb. starts out with some easy 5.8 slab climbing. goes up to a small diheidral then 5.9 climbing for a bit then a couple 5.10 moves pulling the roof which is a bit tricky and feels pretty committing (misty Murphy puts this at 11b. In her guide book,the holds are kinda hard to find going through the crux but once ya know where they are it really is not hard). i don't know the name so feel free to leave a comment with it or any other info about this climb.

nice and easy to get off the ground then right into the business. which is very reachy and sequential. really fun though. goes realy chill after you clear the overhanging part. maybe 5.9 for the rest of it. really fun powerful line.
content.location: first line to the right of sunset lanes starts on the overhanging yellowish wall.

content.description:
The line right of Frick. Long pulls on very thin holds right off the ground. Get ready to boulder and make some clips. Once over the lip it relaxes quite a bit.

The guide says 12b, but I think this a fair amount harder than Frick (12b).
content.location: Right of Frack and the longer routes (Shell Shocked, It's a Good Life, etc.)

content.description: Sharp crux on the bottom third,  to easy fun climbing at the top.
content.location: left most route on the Alley. left of Shits and Giggles.

content.description: Starts out on two huge pockets / small huecos. Crux is around bolt 4-6 and then it’s easy climbing to chains.
content.location: Between Therapy and Sondance. Start is slightly left of a tree. The two large pockets at the first bolt will help you distinguish this route from its neighbors.

content.description: Traverse right on some decent holds then fight your way into a knee bar then move through some really dissappointingly small holds up to a jug which has a huge move with not!much for foot holds then to some decent holds to some crimpers and then done.
content.protection: draws. also might be pre hung
content.location: just left of shellshocked. comes out of the right side of the cave there.

content.description: Pretty straightforward climb. a little tricky at the top. good climb though. don't know the name so feel free to comment with it if you know it.
content.location: first route on the wall. it's a slab all the way to the chains
